Class Board

extends java.lang.Object

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Default Constructor for Board, calls initialize() and creates an empty 9x9 2D array of empty Towers.

    • Field Detail

      • dropPhaseOver

        public java.lang.Boolean dropPhaseOver

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Default Constructor for Board, calls initialize() and creates an empty 9x9 2D array of empty Towers.

    • Method Detail

      • getDrops

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getDrops(Player player,
                                          int piece)
        Returns an array of Moves of all possible spots a specific piece that the player selected can drop. During the game's initial phase, pieces can only be dropped on the first 3 rows of each player's side. Also, there must be a pawn for each player in each column. During the initial stage, pieces can be stacked on each other but after the initial phase, pieces can only be dropped on empty spaces. After the initial phase, the range of possible drop spots extends from the player's side to just before the other player's first 3 rows.
        Parameters:
        player - current player dropping
        piece - piece that the player wants to drop
        Returns:
        ArrayList of moves that represent all possible spots that piece can be dropped.

      • dropPiece

        public java.lang.Boolean dropPiece(Player player,
                                   int piece,
                                   Move pos)
        finds a matching piece to "piece" and adds it to the top of the tower with position "pos", if piece cannot be found in the player's hand then it doesn't do anything
        Parameters:
        player - current player
        piece - piece that the player wants to drop onto board, position of piece in hand
        pos - position of the tower on the board that the player wants to drop their piece
        Returns:
        true/false

      • actionPiece

        public void actionPiece(Player attacker,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Move> moves,
                        Move from)
        This method is called from the Game class in the method 'playerTurn'. The player is prompted to input where they want to move their piece and the piece is moved if the input was in the availble move list. If not the function calls itself recursively so the player can input a new move.
        Parameters:
        attacker - The player that is attacking
        moves - ArrayList of available moves for the piece
        from - Original location of the moving piece

      • actionRangedPiece

        public void actionRangedPiece(Player attacker,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Move> moves,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Move> attacks,
                              Move from)
        Same as the 'actionPiece' method above except with special modifications to accommadate the functionality of ranged pieces which have separate move sets for moving and capturing.
        Parameters:
        attacker - The player that is attacking
        moves - ArrayList of available moves for the piece
        attacks - ArrayList of available attacks for the piece
        from - Original location of the moving piece

      • capturePiece

        public void capturePiece(Player attacker,
                         Tower ally,
                         Tower enemy)
        calls capturePiece() from Player class. Captures the target tower's top piece and then moves the attacking piece to the target's position.
        Parameters:
        attacker - The player that is attacking
        ally - piece that the player will be using to attack
        enemy - piece that the player is targeting

      • getTower

        public static Tower getTower(int i,
                             int j)
        Allows other classes to access the towers in board. returns the tower at positon i, j
        Parameters:
        i - row number
        j - column number
        Returns:
        Tower at (i,j)

      • accessTower

        public static Tower accessTower(Move pos)
        Allows other classes to access the towers in board. returns the tower at pos
        Parameters:
        pos - position of tower
        Returns:
        Tower at pos

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Creates the 2D array of empty Towers for the Board. Each 9x9 spot has one empty tower.

      • checkEmpty

        public static boolean checkEmpty(int r,
                                 int c)
        checkEmpty will check if a certain Tower on the board is empty or not. r is used for the rows and c is used for the columns. Returns a boolean that indicates whether the tower is empty or not.
        Parameters:
        r - row number of the board
        c - column number of the board
        Returns:
        boolean true/false if the tower is empty or not.

      • checkIfEnemyOrAllyTowerNotFull

        public static boolean checkIfEnemyOrAllyTowerNotFull(Piece p,
                                                     int r,
                                                     int c)
        Returns true if the target location is occupied by a tower whose top piece belongs to the opposing player.
        Parameters:
        p - piece
        r - row number of the board
        c - column number of the board
        Returns:
        boolean returns true if the square is occupied by a tower whose top piece is a different color than the parameter 'p'.

      • checkForCommander

        public static boolean checkForCommander(int r,
                                        int c)
        Checks the tower at position r, c for a commander.
        Parameters:
        r - row number
        c - column number
        Returns:
        true/false

      • checkForSpy

        public static boolean checkForSpy(int r,
                                  int c)
        Checks the tower at position r, c for a spy
        Parameters:
        r - row number
        c - column number
        Returns:
        true/false

      • checkIfTowerNotFull

        public static boolean checkIfTowerNotFull(int r,
                                          int c)
        checks if the tower at the position r, c is full or not
        Parameters:
        r - row number
        c - column number
        Returns:
        true/false

      • checkEmpty

        public boolean checkEmpty(Move position)
        checkEmpty will check if a certain Tower on the board is empty or not. r is used for the rows and c is used for the columns. Returns a boolean that indicates whether the tower is empty or not.
        Parameters:
        position - postion
        Returns:
        boolean true/false if the tower is empty or not.

      • checkRowForPawn

        public java.lang.Boolean checkRowForPawn(Player player,
                                         int col)
        Checks the specified row for a pawn belonging to the specified player. Used during initial dropping phase.
        Parameters:
        player - Player that's dropping
        col - column number
        Returns:
        true/false

      • checkRanged

        public boolean checkRanged(Move position)
        checks to see if the top piece on the Tower at the indicated position is an archer or musketeer.
        Parameters:
        position - the target tower's position
        Returns:
        true if it is archer or musketeer, else false

      • addToBoard

        public void addToBoard(Piece piece,
                       Move pos)
        Adds the piece to the selected position
        Parameters:
        piece - piece to be dropped
        pos - position

      • setDropPhaseOver

        public void setDropPhaseOver()
        sets dropPhaseOver to true, indicating that the initial drop phase is over. This changes the dropping behavior.

      • boardToString

        public java.lang.String boardToString()
        returns a string representation of the board. Each tower is represented by its pieces' ids.
        Returns:
        String of board

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Displays the entire Board and its towers to the console. Each piece has a unique indicator and empty towers are left blank.

      • playerInitializeDrop

        public void playerInitializeDrop(Player p)
        Begins the initial dropping phase. Randomizes the piece and position dropped. Not used in actual game between players, only for testing.
        Parameters:
        p - Current player dropping

      • getDrops

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getDrops(Player p)
        Returns an array of moves that represent the available positions a piece can be dropped. During initial drop phase, pieces can be dropped in the first two rows of the respective players and can also be dropped on top of each other, excluding the commander. After the initial dropping phase, pieces can be dropped up to the other player's side of the board, not including the other player's first two rows. Also, pieces can no longer be dropped on top of each other.
        Parameters:
        p - Current Player
        Returns:
        arraylist of available dropping spots

      • getPotentialRangedAttacks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getPotentialRangedAttacks(Tower t)
        Gets all the possible spots a musketeer or archer can attack.
        Parameters:
        t - Tower with an archer or musketeer on top
        Returns:
        arraylist of possible attack spots

      • getRangedAttacks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getRangedAttacks(Tower t)
        Gets all the potential captures an archer or musketeer can make that turn. Different from getPotentialRangedAttacks, this only returns possible captures and not empty squares
        Parameters:
        t - Attacking Tower
        Returns:
        arraylist of targets

      • getMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getMoves(Tower t)
        Gets a list of all possible moves a piece can make.
        Parameters:
        t - Tower containing piece that will be moving
        Returns:
        ArrayList of possible movement spots

      • antiCheck

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Move> antiCheck(Piece p,
                                                  java.util.ArrayList<Move> moveList)
        Prevents the COMMANDER from moving into check. It accomplishes this by finding all the possible moves of all pieces owned by the opponent of the owner of the moving COMMANDER. Returns the ArrayList of possible moves.
        Parameters:
        p - The commander being moved
        moveList - movelist of commander
        Returns:
        corrected movelist for commander.

      • checkForImmobileStrike

        public boolean checkForImmobileStrike(Tower t,
                                      char turn)
        Checks if an immobile strike can be performed
        Parameters:
        t - Tower
        turn - current player
        Returns:
        true/false

      • checkForReclaim

        public boolean checkForReclaim(Tower t)
        checks if a pawn or spy can be reclaimed, when it reaches the other side's last two rows.
        Parameters:
        t - Tower
        Returns:
        true/false

      • deleteRepeats

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Move> deleteRepeats(java.util.ArrayList<Move> myList)
        Supplements the function "antiCheck" by trimming the output ArrayList of all repeat Moves
        Parameters:
        myList - The ArrayList to be trimmed
        Returns:
        Corrected arraylist without repeats
